info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 7:32AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...An area of thunderstorms with intense lightning and heavy rainfall will impact portions of Greenville...Spartanburg... Anderson...and Pickens Counties through 815 AM EDT... At 728 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the leading edge of an area of thunderstorms with intense lightning and heavy rainfall along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Greenville Downtown to 8 miles northeast of Anderson, and moving east at 35 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Greenville, Easley, Powdersville, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville, Berea and Five Forks. In addition to intense lightning, very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters. Frequent lightning is occurring with these storms. If outdoors, try to get indoors or into a hard topped vehicle. Otherwise, stay away from open areas and isolated high objects such as trees. When indoors, stay away from windows and doors and avoid using wired electronic devices. Do not take a shower or bath. Try to unplug unnecessary appliances before the storms approach.
